instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: Liquid damage. Arround U5410 is all destroyed. I cannot put it back. I had to clean to remove short. So, can I do a bridg? 3V to R5419 is enought?

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: Not a good idea. Just run the 6 wires to make it work again.

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: At least to check if board power? I am not sure if there are more issues.

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message:
I am missing 3.3V S0. I have green light. First thing I checked is I have stable 3.42V but I am missing smc_adapter_en. I reflowed SMC but no reaction.
What is next to check?

smc_reset_L at 3V

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: Crap under or dead SMC. This board does not sound good :(

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: So, replace SMC and if doesnot work goes to the trash? I reflowed 2 times the SMC with flux but no reaction.

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: I'll leave the trash decision up to you.

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: Replaced SMC and still magsafe, but no smc_adapter_en

threads.title: 820-3115 missing u5410
threads.message: Any corroded resistors around the SMC? PPBUS present?
